I followed the link and by the description of the service and events based
architecture it looks like Vladimir is doing some good stuff. I personally
don't mind it not looking like JUnit any more as long as it is well
architected/written and existing test cases continue to operate without
change. Is there any indication as to whether or when any of the ideas/code
that Vladimir has produced will be accepted into production?

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Vladimir Bossicard [mailto:vladimir@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, November 27, 2001 7:27 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] Making JUnit more pluggable for add-ons
>
>
> > P.S. On the topic at hand, I know that Vladimir Bossicard has
> implemented a
> > scheme that will let you register services with the junit
> architecture for
> > letting you extend it easily for custom reporting and what-not.
> I don't know
> > the current status of that effort though so perhaps he can comment?
>
>
> He can comment, he can :-)
>
> My project (www.bossicard.com/projects/junit.php) is the result of all
> the experiments I made on JUnit over the last nine months.  I choose
> this way not to replace JUnit but to see how users' requests could be
> implemented in JUnit (the official version).  I agree I coded a little
> bit too much and my version does not look like JUnit anymore :-)
> Because this project is a prototype and not a replacement to the
> official version, I am not putting too much effort in it anymore and
> wait to see the direction Erich and Kent take with their framework.
>
> I am also working on another project with the idea to have more
> flexibility while running your tests (defining services accessible by
> all tests (single db connection, CORBA service, logging mechanism...),
> replacing the different property and allTests.java files with XML files,
> writing the output in an XML file and then converting it into HTML, text
> file..., providing metrics for every test (and not only the failed
> one),... ).  For those interested: www.bossicard.com/apricot, I'll
> release some code in the new few days.
>
> -Vladimir
